name: Fighter

proficiencies.armor: All armor types and shields (including tower shields)

1.name: Bonus Feat
1.description: At 1st level, a fighter gets a bonus combat-oriented feat in addition to the feat that any 1st-level character gets and the bonus feat granted to a human character. The fighter gains an additional bonus feat at 2nd level and every two fighter levels thereafter (4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, 18th, and 20th). These bonus feats must be drawn from the feats noted as fighter bonus feats.

2.name: Bonus Feat
2.description: At 2nd level and every two levels thereafter, the fighter gains a bonus feat.

description: Fighters excel at combatâ€”defeating their enemies, controlling the flow of battle, and surviving such sorties themselves. While their specific weapons and methods grant them a wide variety of tactics, few can match fighters for sheer battle prowess.

name: Wizard

proficiencies.weapon: Club, dagger, heavy crossbow, light crossbow, quarterstaff

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: A wizard casts arcane spells which are drawn from the sorcerer/wizard spell list. A wizard must choose and prepare his spells ahead of time (see below).

1.name: Bonus Languages
1.description: A wizard may substitute Draconic for one of the bonus languages available to the character because of his race.

1.name: Familiar
1.description: A wizard can obtain a familiar in exactly the same manner as a sorcerer can.

1.name: Scribe Scroll
1.description: At 1st level, a wizard gains Scribe Scroll as a bonus feat.

5.name: Bonus Feat
5.description: At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th level, a wizard gains a bonus feat. At each such opportunity, she can choose a metamagic feat, an item creation feat, or Spell Mastery.

description: Wizards are arcane spellcasters who depend on intensive study to create their magic. They examine musty old tomes, debate magical theory with their peers, and practice minor magics whenever they can.

name: Cleric

proficiencies.weapon: All simple weapons, plus the favored weapon of their deity
proficiencies.armor: All armor types and shields (except tower shields)

1.name: Aura
1.description: A cleric of a chaotic, evil, good, or lawful deity has a particularly powerful aura corresponding to the deity's alignment.

1.name: Spells
1.description: A cleric casts divine spells, which are drawn from the cleric spell list. However, his alignment may restrict him from casting certain spells opposed to his moral or ethical beliefs.

1.name: Domains and Domain Spells
1.description: A deity's influence is felt most strongly through his or her domains. Each domain gives the cleric access to a domain spell at each spell level he can cast, from 1st on up, as well as a granted power.

1.name: Spontaneous Casting
1.description: A good cleric (or a neutral cleric of a good deity) can channel stored spell energy into healing spells that the cleric did not prepare ahead of time. The cleric can "lose" any prepared spell that is not a domain spell in order to cast any cure spell of the same spell level or lower.

1.name: Turn or Rebuke Undead
1.description: Any cleric, regardless of alignment, has the power to affect undead creatures by channeling the power of his faith through his holy (or unholy) symbol.

alignment_restrictions: Within one step of deity's alignment
description: Clerics are masters of divine magic. Divine magic, unlike arcane magic, is power granted from a divine source.

name: Rogue

proficiencies.weapon: All simple weapons, plus hand crossbow, rapier, sap, shortbow, and short sword

1.name: Sneak Attack
1.description: If a rogue can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her attack, she can strike a vital spot for extra damage. The rogue's attack deals extra damage any time her target would be denied a Dexterity bonus to AC, or when the rogue flanks her target. This extra damage is +1d6 at 1st level, and it increases by +1d6 every two rogue levels thereafter.

1.name: Trapfinding
1.description: Rogues (and only rogues) can use the Search skill to locate traps when the task has a Difficulty Class higher than 20. Rogues (and only rogues) can use the Disable Device skill to disarm magic traps.

2.name: Evasion
2.description: At 2nd level and higher, a rogue can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility. If she makes a successful Reflex saving throw against an attack that normally deals half damage on a successful save, she instead takes no damage.

3.name: Trap Sense
3.description: Starting at 3rd level, a rogue gains an intuitive sense that alerts her to danger from traps, giving her a +1 bonus on Reflex saves made to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to AC against attacks made by traps.

description: Rogues have little in common with each other. While some - maybe even the majority - are stealthy thieves, many serve as scouts, spies, investigators, diplomats, and simple thugs.

name: Ranger

proficiencies.armor: Light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields)

1.name: Favored Enemy
1.description: At 1st level, a ranger may select a type of creature from among those given on the ranger favored enemies table. The ranger gains a +2 bonus on Bluff, Listen, Sense Motive, Spot, and Survival checks when using these skills against creatures of this type. Likewise, he gets a +2 bonus on weapon damage rolls against such creatures.

1.name: Track
1.description: A ranger gains Track as a bonus feat.

1.name: Wild Empathy
1.description: A ranger can improve the attitude of an animal.

2.name: Combat Style
2.description: At 2nd level, a ranger must select one of two combat styles to pursue: archery or two-weapon combat.

3.name: Endurance
3.description: A ranger gains Endurance as a bonus feat at 3rd level.

4.name: Animal Companion
4.description: At 4th level, a ranger gains an animal companion.

4.name: Spells
4.description: Beginning at 4th level, a ranger gains the ability to cast a small number of divine spells.

description: Rangers are skilled hunters and trackers who live on the edges of civilization.

name: Paladin

proficiencies.armor: All armor types and shields (except tower shields)

1.name: Aura of Good
1.description: The power of a paladin's aura of good is equal to her paladin level.

1.name: Detect Evil
1.description: At will, a paladin can use detect evil, as the spell.

1.name: Smite Evil
1.description: Once per day, a paladin may attempt to smite evil with one normal melee attack. She adds her Charisma bonus (if any) to her attack roll and deals 1 extra point of damage per paladin level.

2.name: Divine Grace
2.description: At 2nd level, a paladin gains a bonus equal to her Charisma bonus (if any) on all saving throws.

2.name: Lay on Hands
2.description: Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin with a Charisma score of 12 or higher can heal wounds (her own or those of others) by touch.

3.name: Aura of Courage
3.description: Beginning at 3rd level, a paladin is immune to fear (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale bonus on saving throws against fear effects.

3.name: Divine Health
3.description: At 3rd level, a paladin gains immunity to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases.

4.name: Turn Undead
4.description: When a paladin reaches 4th level, she gains the supernatural ability to turn undead.

4.name: Spells
4.description: Beginning at 4th level, a paladin gains the ability to cast a small number of divine spells.

5.name: Special Mount
5.description: Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin gains the service of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed to serve her in her crusade against evil.

description: Paladins take their adventures seriously, and have a pronounced streak of self-righteousness.

name: Barbarian

proficiencies.weapon: All simple and martial weapons, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields)
proficiencies.armor: Light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields)

1.name: Fast Movement
1.description: A barbarian's land speed is faster than the norm for his race by +10 feet when wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor and not carrying a heavy load.

1.name: Illiteracy
1.description: Barbarians are the only characters who do not automatically know how to read and write.

1.name: Rage
1.description: A barbarian can fly into a rage a certain number of times per day. In a rage, a barbarian temporarily gains a +4 bonus to Strength, a +4 bonus to Constitution, and a +2 morale bonus on Will saves, but he takes a â€“2 penalty to Armor Class.

2.name: Uncanny Dodge
2.description: At 2nd level, a barbarian retains his Dexterity bonus to AC (if any) even if he is caught flat-footed or struck by an invisible attacker.

3.name: Trap Sense
3.description: Starting at 3rd level, a barbarian gains a +1 bonus on Reflex saves made to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to AC against attacks made by traps.

description: From the frozen wastes of the north and the hellish jungles of the south come brave, even reckless, warriors. Civilized people call them barbarians or berserkers and suspect them of mayhem, impiety, and atrocities.

name: Sorcerer

1.name: Spells
1.description: A sorcerer casts arcane spells which are drawn from the sorcerer/wizard spell list. She can cast any spell she knows without preparing it ahead of time.

1.name: Familiar
1.description: A sorcerer can obtain a familiar.

description: Sorcerers have no need for the spellbooks and hours of study of wizards. Instead, they manipulate raw magic through force of personality.

name: Bard

proficiencies.weapon: All simple weapons, plus longsword, rapier, sap, short sword, shortbow, and whip
proficiencies.armor: Light armor and shields (except tower shields)

1.name: Bardic Music
1.description: Once per day per bard level, a bard can use his song or poetics to produce magical effects on those around him.

1.name: Bardic Knowledge
1.description: A bard may make a special bardic knowledge check with a bonus equal to his bard level + his Intelligence modifier to see whether he knows some relevant information about local notable people, legendary items, or noteworthy places.

1.name: Countersong
1.description: A bard with 3 or more ranks in a Perform skill can use his music or poetics to counter magical effects that depend on sound.

1.name: Fascinate
1.description: A bard with 3 or more ranks in a Perform skill can use his music or poetics to cause one or more creatures to become fascinated with him.

2.name: Spells
2.description: Beginning at 2nd level, a bard gains the ability to cast a small number of arcane spells.

3.name: Inspire Courage
3.description: A bard with 6 or more ranks in a Perform skill can use song or poetics to inspire courage in his allies.

description: Bards often serve as negotiators, messengers, scouts, and spies. They love to accompany heroes (and villains) to witness heroic (or villainous) deeds firsthand.

name: Druid

proficiencies.weapon: Club, dagger, dart, quarterstaff, scimitar, sickle, shortspear, sling, and spear. Druids are prohibited from using metal armor and shields
proficiencies.armor: Nonmetal armor and shields (but not tower shields)

1.name: Animal Companion
1.description: A druid may begin play with an animal companion selected from the following list: badger, camel, dire rat, dog, riding dog, eagle, hawk, horse (light or heavy), owl, pony, snake (Small or Medium viper), or wolf.

1.name: Nature Sense
1.description: A druid gains a +2 bonus on Knowledge (nature) and Survival checks.

1.name: Wild Empathy
1.description: A druid can improve the attitude of an animal.

1.name: Spells
1.description: A druid casts divine spells, which are drawn from the druid spell list.

2.name: Woodland Stride
2.description: Starting at 2nd level, a druid may move through any sort of undergrowth (such as natural thorns, briars, overgrown areas, and similar terrain) at her normal speed and without taking damage or suffering any other impairment.

3.name: Trackless Step
3.description: Starting at 3rd level, a druid leaves no trail in natural surroundings and cannot be tracked.

4.name: Resist Nature's Lure
4.description: Starting at 4th level, a druid gains a +4 bonus on saving throws against the spell-like abilities of fey.

5.name: Wild Shape
5.description: At 5th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into any Small or Medium animal and back again once per day.

alignment_restrictions: Neutral (must be neutral on at least one axis)
description: Druids are divine spellcasters who receive their spells from nature, not from gods. They strive to live in harmony with the natural world, and hate anything that is not part of the natural cycle.

name: Monk

proficiencies.weapon: Club, crossbow (light or heavy), dagger, handaxe, javelin, kama, nunchaku, quarterstaff, sai, shuriken, siangham, sling

1.name: Bonus Feat
1.description: A monk may select either Improved Grapple or Stunning Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level. At 2nd level, she may select either Combat Reflexes or Deflect Arrows as a bonus feat. At 6th level, she may select either Improved Disarm or Improved Trip as a bonus feat.

1.name: Flurry of Blows
1.description: When unarmored, a monk may strike with a flurry of blows at the expense of accuracy.

1.name: Unarmed Strike
1.description: A monk gains Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus feat. A monk's attacks may be with either fist interchangeably or even from elbows, knees, and feet.

2.name: Bonus Feat
2.description: At 2nd level, a monk may select either Combat Reflexes or Deflect Arrows as a bonus feat.

2.name: Evasion
2.description: At 2nd level or higher, a monk can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility.

3.name: Still Mind
3.description: A monk of 3rd level or higher gains a +2 bonus on saving throws against enchantment spells and effects.

4.name: Ki Strike
4.description: At 4th level, a monk's unarmed attacks are empowered with ki. Her unarmed attacks are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of dealing damage to creatures with damage reduction.

4.name: Slow Fall
4.description: At 4th level or higher, a monk within arm's reach of a wall can use it to slow her descent.

description: Monks are versatile warriors skilled at fighting without weapons or armor. Good-aligned monks serve as protectors of the people, while evil monks make ideal spies and assassins.
